alert.note: Alert for Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 02 at 5:44PM CDT until May 02 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL GRADY COUNTY... At 543 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Norge, moving east at 30 mph. There is a second area of rotation near Ninnekah. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Alex, Amber, Norge, Tabler, Ninnekah and Laverty. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 74 and 89. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
